snippet: If the Devils had won four of their 11 shootouts this season, they would have entered this next-to-last weekend of the regular season in a wild-card playoff spot.
abstract: Slap Shot blog; New Jersey Devils have lost all 11 shootouts they have been in this season and an NHL-record 15 consecutive over all since March 2013; if they had won four of their 11 shootouts this season, they would have entered the next-to-last weekend of the regular season in a wild-card playoff spot; instead, they are a point back.
lead_paragraph: If the Devils had won four of their 11 shootouts this season, they would have entered this next-to-last weekend of the regular season in a wild-card playoff spot.

headline.main: For the Devils, Shootouts Become a No-Win Mind Game
headline.print_headline: For the Devils, Shootouts Become a No-Win Mind Game
